intro: Calycothrix glabra var. ciliata, commonly known as the hairy calycothrix, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
